summary: This bill, the United States-Abraham Accords Cooperation and Security Act of 2025, proposes establishing an Abraham Accords Office within the Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The office, headed by a director, will be responsible for providing technical assistance and facilitating interactions between the FDA and Abraham Accords countries to strengthen regulatory oversight of regulated products, particularly around manufacturing medical products. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will report to Congress on the office's progress within three years of the bill's enactment.
